sentence.Network_en: "One thing you can never insure against is corruption among your staff."—"Agreed."
sentence.Network_cn: “永远也防不胜防的就是员工内部的贪污腐败。”——“同意。”

sentence.Network_en: Police corruption is not just a few rotten apples.
sentence.Network_cn: 警方的腐败不仅仅是几个害群之马造成的。

sentence.Network_en: The proposals are an attempt to rid the country of political corruption.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些提议试图使这个国家摆脱政治腐败。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: via Old French from Latin corruptio(n-), from corrumpere 'mar, bribe, destroy' (see corrupt)

entry.def: Corruption is dishonesty and illegal behaviour by people in positions of authority or power.

example.ex: The President faces 54 charges of corruption and tax evasion...
example.tran: 总统面临54项腐败和逃税的指控。

example.ex: Distribution of food throughout the country is being hampered by inefficiency and corruption.
example.tran: 低效和腐败行为阻碍了食品在全国的分发。

entry.def: In linguistics, a corruption is a word that is derived from an earlier word, but which has become changed in some way.

example.ex: 'Morris' is an English corruption of 'Moorish', meaning North African.
example.tran: Morris 在英语中是 Moorish 的变体，意思是“北非的”。

means.word_mean: 1. lack of integrity or honesty (especially susceptibility to bribery); use of a position of trust for dishonest gain
2. in a state of progressive putrefaction
3. decay of matter (as by rot or oxidation)
4. moral perversion; impairment of virtue and moral principles;

sentences.sentence: "the luxury and corruption among the upper classes"
"its brothels; its opium parlors; its depravity"

means.word_mean: 5. destroying someone's (or some group's) honesty or loyalty; undermining moral integrity;

sentences.sentence: "the big city's subversion of rural innocence"

means.word_mean: 6. inducement (as of a public official) by improper means (as bribery) to violate duty (as by commiting a felony);

sentences.sentence: "he was held on charges of corruption and racketeering"

auth_sentence.content: He has also been a consistent campaigner against corruption.
auth_sentence.res_content: He has also been a consistent campaigner against corruption.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He has also been a consistent campaigner against corruption.

auth_sentence.content: China has launched several anti-corruption campaigns in recent years.
auth_sentence.res_content: China has launched several anti-corruption campaigns in recent years.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: China has launched several anti-corruption campaigns in recent years.

auth_sentence.content: Mama... please come down strongly on corruption in Liberia.
auth_sentence.res_content: Mama... please come down strongly on corruption in Liberia.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Mama... please come down strongly on corruption in Liberia.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 突然的,出其不意的;[行为等]粗鲁无礼的
stems_affixes.word_buile: ab离开+rupt断裂→突然的[断开,离开]
bank银行+rupt断裂→adj.破产的;彻底缺乏的 v.使破产n.破产者
cor全部+rupt断→全部断→变坏的,腐败的
bank银行+rupt断裂→adj.破产的;彻底缺乏的 v.使破产n.破产者
corrupt[adj.腐败的;变环的]+ion表名词→n.腐化;腐坏;败坏
disrupt[v.使混乱,使崩溃,使分裂,使瓦解]+ion表名词→n.中断,分裂,瓦解,破坏
interrupt[v.中断,遮断,阻碍;打断[话],打扰]+ion表名词→n.中断,打断;障碍物

stems_affixes.value_cn: 破裂, 决裂, 敌对, 割裂
stems_affixes.word_buile: rupt断裂+ure→n.&v.破裂, 决裂, 敌对, 割裂
bank银行+rupt断裂→adj.破产的;彻底缺乏的 v.使破产n.破产者

stems_affixes.value_cn: 使混乱,使崩溃,使分裂,使瓦解
stems_affixes.word_buile: dis分开+rupt断裂→分开断→使崩溃,瓦解

stems_affixes.value_cn: 中断,遮断,阻碍;打断[话],打扰
stems_affixes.word_buile: inter在……中间+rupt断裂→讲话中间被打断

sentences.en: Corrupt officials always try to draw the curtain over their corruption.
sentences.cn: 贪官污吏总是企图掩盖自己的腐败行为。

sentences.en: Claims of corruption within the police force were denied.
sentences.cn: 警察内部腐败的说法被否定了。

sentences.en: A corruption scandals led to the fall of the government.
sentences.cn: 一件贪污腐败事件导致政府垮台。
